com.google.appinventor.shared.simple
Interface ComponentDatabaseInterface

All Known Implementing Classes:
SimpleComponentDatabase
public interface ComponentDatabaseInterface

Database holding property and event information of Simple components.

Author:
lizlooney@google.com (lizlooney)

Method Detail

getComponentNames

Set<String> getComponentNames()
Returns the component names.

getComponentVersion

int getComponentVersion(String componentTypeName)
Returns the version number of a component.

Parameters:
componentTypeName - name of component to query
Returns:
the component version number

getCategoryString

String getCategoryString(String componentTypeName)
Returns the String version of a component's category. Note that this is the result of calling getString() on a ComponentCategory, not the result of calling getName(). For example, for the ComponentCategory EXPERIMENTAL, this returns "EXPERIMENTAL", not "Not ready for prime time". The procedure was written this way so that the result could be converted back to a ComponentCategory with valueOf().

Parameters:
componentTypeName - name of component to query
Returns:
the component's category

getCategoryDocUrlString

String getCategoryDocUrlString(String componentTypeName)
Returns the appropriate piece of the URL in the goro docs for a component's category (or null, if the mapping is not known).

Parameters:
componentTypeName - name of component to query
Returns:
the URL piece in the docs

getHelpString

String getHelpString(String componentTypeName)
Returns a helpful message about the component. This message originates in the designerHelpDescription field of the component's DesignerComponent annotation, is written to the file "simple_component.json" by ComponentDescriptorGenerator, and is read back by YoungAndroidPalettePanel. It is not allowed to contain HTML or XML markup.

Parameters:
componentTypeName - name of component to query
Returns:
helpful message about the component

getShowOnPalette

boolean getShowOnPalette(String componentTypeName)
Returns whether the component with this name should be shown on the palette. As the time this is written (2/22/10), the only component that should not be shown on the palette is Form/Screen.

Parameters:
componentTypeName - name of component to query
Returns:
whether the component should be shown on the palette

getNonVisible

boolean getNonVisible(String componentTypeName)
Returns whether the component with this name is a "non-visible" component (i.e., one that doesn't have a representation in the UI). Non-visible components can be handled uniformly in the Designer and don't need special MockComponent representations.

Parameters:
componentTypeName - name of component to query
Returns:
whether the component is non-visible

getIconName

String getIconName(String componentTypeName)
Returns the name of the icon file (last part of the path name) for the icon to be shown in the Designer

getPropertyDefinitions

List<ComponentDatabaseInterface.PropertyDefinition> getPropertyDefinitions(String componentTypeName)
Returns a list of a component's property definitions.

Parameters:
componentTypeName - name of component to query
Returns:
list of property definition for the component

getPropertyTypesByName

Map<String,String> getPropertyTypesByName(String componentTypeName)
